Reviews.Title: “Special welcome, wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: tmukau
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel late at night, very tired from travelling and was immediately impressed by the grand front of the hotel and even more so by the welcome I received from the bellhop who took my bags in. This was matched by the man on reception as I checked in and within two minutes, I was in my room. Despite the late hour, the staff were very helpful in organising room service and ironing equipment. I had an attic room with a sloping roof and a wonderful view (as I discovered the next morning) of the Sacre Coeur at Montmarte. The quality of the room decor was high, with a luxury feel and a bathroom to match. The only down side of the room was that there wasn't enough desk space - leaving me feeling squashed into the window bay with my nose pressed against the window, a little bit claustrophobic. The next morning, after an all-too-brief (but very comfortable sleep), I opened the window to gaze on the Basilica of the Sacre Coeur basking in the bright sunshine - a sight to gladden the heart of any Paris lover. The bathroom's huge window, overlooking offices and apartments across the street were curiously without blinds or curtains (the second time I've recently had this in Paris) - just etched at the bottom as a kind of gesture to modesty. An interesting and amusing experience for the typically coy Brit :-) My stay here was all-too-brief. I'd like to have had longer to sample what else the hotel had to offer but what I did experience was of very high quality. This hotel was even closer to my clients' offices than the less comfortable hotel I stayed earlier in the week - so I know where I'll be staying next time I'm in Paris on business.

Reviews.Title: “great location, beautiful decor, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Pysiu
Reviews.Content: Went to Paris for a romantic weekend get away and decided to splurge and stay somwhere very nice. The location of this hotel is fabulous. Opera and Galeries Lafayette right next door, several metro stops and you can walk everywhere. The hotel itself is beautiful, with an unique and fanky decor, which I very much appreciate. I like places with character. This hotel is not cheap, quite expensive I would say, which of course raises expectations. You will find in paris many overpriced hotels, which are very basic and cramped. This one is diferent, pricey but roomie and posh. You feel you are staying in a special place. We upgraded our room to a superior/deluxe and were quite disappointed with it size. Maybe for Paris was ok but for the price and expectations it was very small. It was very comfortable and nicely decorated with a nice bathroom but it simply was small. The Internet did not work in our room. Breakfast was very nice with many choices and the staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very frindly”
Reviews.Author: AndersB1
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 days and we, a famliy of 3, had a great time. The staff was very frindly and help full. The only thing was that the rooms was very samll, and it was not the cheapest we choose.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel for great price !”
Reviews.Author: lanisterium
Reviews.Content: Excellent and helpfull staff. Hotel stylish and modern Rooms very nice but a bit small. Well furnished. Missing : coffee tray. The bar is nice but at times there will be nobody to serve drinks. One day we were even told at 11 am that there was no champagne :-) still one of our favorites.

Reviews.Title: “Theft”
Reviews.Author: VivianneStaplehurst
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel and on the last day we left our luggage with the concierge. When we arrived home, I discovered that my brand new GHD hair straightener was missing from my suitcase. We complained to management but were never compensated. I would never return or recommend an hotel, however nice it is, if you could not trust the staff

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful contemporary hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: MadTraveller1
Reviews.Content: I just spent 2 nights at the Banke Hotel for a business trip. This is a gorgeous hotel that is centrally located. Walking distance from the metro and attractions as the Opera and Madelaine as well as 3 minutes walking from Galeries LaFayette and other shopping areas. Lots of restaurants around for late dinner or breakfast if you only want a coffee and croissant. The hotel used to be a bank, it is fully renovated with a mix of modern decor and original one. People at the hotel are very helpful and always willing to go the extra mile for any request. The hotel has free wifi which is always helpful when trying to catch up on some work. The bathroom has great ammenities in an airport "compliant" plastic bag. Rooms are comfortable. The only thing I would complaint a bit was the a/c which was not working properly. True that it was one of the coldest days in Paris, but the heater was regulated from the lobby and unless you talk to them they will turn it up. For the rest, absolute courtesy!

Reviews.Title: “For what you pay, you get........?”
Reviews.Author: claytoncast
Reviews.Content: Paris is not a cheap place to stay. One just has to crept that. Important therefore to make sure that wherever you do fork out a couple of hundred euros you are getting some bang for your buck. I had been booked into Hotel Banke on Rue Dd Lafayette by a client. Good central location .Charming welcome by a truly excellent receptionist (Didn't get her name - but glasses and a great smile) who sorted out a problem over who was paying for the room (Not me mercifully) and dispatched me with a porter to my room. The porter was great too explaining the facilities of the hotel as we travelled up to Room 602. Remember the number....and avoid it. At 6'2" I could only stand up in half the room as it had a sloping ceiling being in what I think is commonly referred to as the attic. A television round a corner could not be viewed from the only easy chair in the room, and the bathroom had one small pokey shower. The porter seemed slightly embarrassed by the room and not at all surprised when I said I was afraid that it wouldn't do. He rang down to reception and then he took me down to 302. This was much nicer, not huge, but a sofa at the end of the bed and a full length window. Admittedly a half size bath- shame as nothing more gorgeous than a long evening soak and this bath was not comfortable for that, but certainly better. Why do hotels try to palm you off with the worst room they have left? The room rate as printed in the room says this room goes for €480 a night!!!!! And half a bath!. Free wifi, which I consider a must in any hotel I stay in on business,so that is good, but unless everything is on expenses you'll be out of the room like a shot in search of a supermarche. Pack of 4 biscuits €6.80. Hamburger on room service €22....and half a bath. Nice toiletries - I'll be taking those I'm afraid at these prices, no in room movies, and the hotel corridors and reception are pervaded by s stygian gloom. Kept so dark no doubt so you can;t see how much money you're having to hand over at check out. I had a corporate rate of €230 but still consider that vey expensive for what one got...and of course that is without the €29 breakfast. So well done to the staff, but if its value for money you want I am sure there are much better deals to be had

Reviews.Title: “Once in a life time...”
Reviews.Author: jackolater
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great, very modern feel and the decor is upscale and clean. The location is excellant for walking to everything including the mall and metro. Me the wife and our little dog stayed there for 4 nights. I think the price is comparable to any downtown big city and the staff was friendly and spoke pretty good english at the desk anyway. I was not aware that there was an extra 30 euro per night charge for the dog until check out but that's fine. They arranged for a car to return me to the airport and that was another 80 euros but its worth is just to have someone who know what they are doing makin the arrangements for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very funky, great location, flawed bar service.”
Reviews.Author: slidingdown
Reviews.Content: This is a funky little hotel with a striking reception area and unique, modern rooms. The rooms aren't big, but this is fairly standard in central Paris and the design and great toiletries nicely make up for it. The staff on reception are sweet and helpful, but the Bar area, though very cool with good cocktails, is not easy to be served in. Even with no one else around they seem to enjoy ignoring you. I'd look at this but go elsewhere to drink if you're pushed for time. Will def keep returning to the hotel, though, as it's a great price and buckets of fun if you're in town for business.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but doesnt do what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Richard G
Reviews.Content: Plus: Brilliant location in city centre, easy access to metro and airport bus Friendly staff Clean and tidy, fantastic foyer Good access to local bars and restaurants Minus: Overpriced for service provided Minibar rates extortionate Restaurant/bar very overpriced also, though plenty of local alternatives available Loud A/C unit Other comments: We booked 2 nights at this hotel after a week of skiing looking for somewhere with extra comfort and, as it was my partners first time in Paris we wanted something a little bit extra to increase the feel of being in Paris and the romance. We chose the hotel based on its website, advertising the hotel as boutique with well designed rooms with a Parisien style. In reality the 'Superior' room we were given was far from it. The room was small and had a very generic feel, that could have been any decent travel motel in the world. While it was clean and comfortable enough, for the price we paid I feel a little let down. The price for extras was ridiculous, but not unexpected given its location. We would stay elsewhere for our next visit, Paris is not short of alternatives

Reviews.Title: “beautiful design”
Reviews.Author: Mieke4803
Reviews.Content: Nice building, beautiful decorated. Friendly welcome. At check in, they already charge you more than the total roomprice. Because of a SLH member, we were upgrated. Unfortunatly, the room was at streetside.(traffic ) Rooms were very clean. Breakfast was ok but nothing special. Diner was not good. We ordered 'dos de cabillaud' and they served a very salted piece of cabillaud filet. Food is overpriced. Location is very good. Near Galleries and on walkingdistance of FSH and Place Vendome.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best....”
Reviews.Author: kimlikestotravel
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend at the time took me to Paris for my birthday, and as a bit of a splurge, he took me to the most beautiful Parisian hotel I have ever seen (later, I found out it was because he was planning to propose! Woop!) This hotel is a converted bank (check out the original features in the lobby...stunning!), and the rooms are the biggest I've seen anywhere in Paris for the price. We found it within walking distance to everything, around the corner from Galleries LaFayette (one of the biggest and most glamorous department stores I have ever seen). It is truly a gem in the heart of this amazing city and somewhere we definitely plan to visit again. Thank you so much to the helpful (thankfully bi-lingual) check-in staff, and the housekeeping team. You really made our trip special. Ps. The breakfast is one of the greatest things I have ever experienced! The sautéed greens are the most delicious thing I have ever eaten.....and that was in all of Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Best location, small, unique, pretty.”
Reviews.Author: Nancy B
Reviews.Content: Hotel Banke is a great choice for Right Bank accomodation in Paris. Reasonabe price for Paris, walking distance to the Louvre and Galleri Lafeyette.The lobby is really quite grand, and makes you feel you are somewhere special. I stayed in a large room, especially for Paris, with very elegant and artistic decor. I usually stay on the Left Bank, but I will go bak there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Only because of the staff”
Reviews.Author: danasbox
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located. Breakfast was good. The rooms are VERY small. The lobby could be oh so much better. Yes I'm taking about the giant tacky bottles in the lobby and the plastic stools in the bar, the red paint... But the staff made this a great stay. If it was not for the staff this really would have been just an okay boutique hotel. The front desk crew, the door men and even the bar-keep were all way above the industry standard. Keep your staff and upgrade the lobby a bit and you'll have a great hotel. We would consider it again!

Reviews.Title: “I did not like this hotel; there must be better places to stay in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: pinkie-and-perkie
Reviews.Content: This hotel thinks it is cool but it isn't. Everything is dark and red. This sometimes works well but not here. The rooms are small and I didn't like the style of decoration. The marble in the bathroom is revolting. A small amount of money went missing from my room. And the cleaner left the heat on max so it was sweltering when I returned. On the plus side, the bed was comfortable, but I suspect if there had been two of us in it then it would have been too small as I am tall and slept diagonally. More importantly, the staff were charming, friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip to Paris!”
Reviews.Author: al6614
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the Banke Hotel. Check in was very easy and efficient. The hotel itself is very beautiful and I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The rooms are quite small, but that is expected in Paris (so I hear). Although small, still very elegant and well kept. The bed was comfortable and there was plenty of room for my belongings. I was only there for a weekend and was by myself so I could understand if you were staying as a couple and for more than a weekend that the room may become crowded. However, there's so much to do in Paris, I doubt that people spend a great amount of time in the rooms. The bathroom was actually quite large and very updated and nice. Also there are comfortable robes and slippers available for guests. The location of the hotel is very convenient. Many restaurants to choose from and taxis and train available for transport. Overall, the hotel was the perfect place to stay and I'd definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent if pricey hotel for a business stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: skyedog
Reviews.Content: Very kind, very helpful, and very accommodating staff at this very stylish, very comfortable hotel. Breakfast a bit pricey, but was outstanding. Location was perfect for my business trip, very close to Gare du Nord and Gare d'Lest rail stations which was critical for my trip. Only complaint was a maintenance item, room was very warm. Engineer made no fewer than three trips to my room to attempt to remedy this problem. when it was obvious that there was nothing else to fix it, the manager offered to move me to a different room. Receptionist was very sweet and very tolerant of my horrible French. Room was very stylish and modern. Bathroom was 1st rate.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but Excellent Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: flygirl444
Reviews.Content: We spent one very comfortable night in the Banke hotel on a short weekend in Paris, which is just around the corner from the Galeries Lafayette on a quiet side street near the Le Peletier Metro station, and with a Velib station nearby too. From the moment we entered the stunning reception area we received a warm welcome from the staff. I am always afraid of getting tiny hotel rooms in Paris but we were informed on arrival that we'd been upgraded to a Deluxe room, and were delighted at the size of our room which was cosy, comfortable, romantic and stylish. The bed and bedding ensured a really excellent night's sleep (and afternoon nap!) or somewhere to have a lie-down after reading the prices for the minibar (8 euro for a small bottle of Evian!). Everything about this hotel is stylish, but it also has substance. Having paid 275 euro for the room, we declined the 28 euro per head breakfast in favour of coffee and croissants in a cafe - much more Parisian. The area around the hotel is pretty much dead at night-time, so hop in a taxi or on the Metro and head off to St Germain or Le Marais for some Parisian nightlife. The doorman was happy to call a taxi whenever one was needed. Small gripes would be - offer a more affordable breakfast and we would happily have breakfasted there, no maps or guides in the rooms, but there was free Wi-fi throughout the hotel. Would recommend this hotel for any trip to Paris and would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Too much focus on design”
Reviews.Author: PHILIPMARSHALL
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night on a business trip (booked due to location). It had many positives, but overall I felt it focused too much on trying to appear "hip" versus delivering a comfortable experience. In summary: Positives: 1) Polite and efficient check-in and check-out. 2) Good location, 5mins taxi to Gard du Nord. 3) Clean room with comfortable bed. Sufficient hot water for shower. 4) Good breakfast options and comfortable setting. 5) Nice bar area & service. Negatives: 1) Small room and missing some basics (eg tea making) 2) Shockingly small cupboard. So small (or so badly designed) that it wasn't possible to hang a suit or jacket (insuffcient depth so I had to hang them in the bathroom!). 3) Glass cover on shower too small (common theme) so floor was partially soaked. 4) Breakfast was a mixture of buffet and service. Issue with service was there were plenty of staff but they appeared to be blind to the fact you needed more juice, etc. 5) Gym & sauna does not exist in reality. It has been built purely to advertise that they have one on their website. In reality, the space is shockingly small (common theme), the gym consisting of 3 bike machines (very close to each other), two showers, a small sauna and a steam cubicle (seats two). Design is so bad that when you walk into the room (from the corridor) you face the showers (which in turn open up to the bike machines and sauna). So unless you enjoy being nude, the design is awful. I personally wouldn't use the hotel again, although I could see for many it would have appeal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, some nice staff but”
Reviews.Author: Connolly47
Reviews.Content: Hotel Banke is an extraordinary renovation of a classic turn of the 20th century building. The foyer is magnificent. The position near Galleries lafayette and the Opera and just about evrything else including the Eurostar station at Gare Du Nord is perfect. But....this is not a hotel for business people...ssome of the staff are sensational..some of the front desk couldnt care less..and finding no toilet roll just when you need it is probably not an endearing feature.

Reviews.Title: “Great stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: bronte75
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first part of our honeymoon and had booked one of the suites which was stunning and huge with 2 dressing rooms etc. It certainly isn't a cheap option and there is no way we could have afforded to stay here if it hadn't been such a special occasion. The room was really cold initially but the staff were extremely helpful and eager to please and managed to get the heating repaired by the next day for us. It was a very peaceful in the hotel, our room was well sound-proofed and a general relaxed atmosphere. The hotel staff were very patient with our attempts to speak french and were very happy to offer suggestions for local restaurants and make bookings for us etc. The 'spa' was a little disappointing with just a steam room (which didn't seem to generate much steam and felt cold) and a small sauna. One of the doors on the shower was nearly falling off too which was a bit alarming! I'm not sure it really is worth having it there overall. The food was good and well presented but again a bit on the pricey side. We managed to negotiate a deal for a breakfast rate as there was some confusion on our booking if it was included or not. This hotel certainly is stylish and a good location for exploring the city. The main positives were the staff and the beauty of the building, the main negatives were the prices and some minor maintenance things.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish but beds too small!”
Reviews.Author: sugardoc1
Reviews.Content: The hotel Banke is a converted bank on Rue Lafayette, close to opera, convienient for all central Paris. They have done a good job, it is very stylish. I nearly tripped up on my face on an invisble huge black step on the way to reception. The corrridors are also very gloomy too. The hotel is expensive, and breakfast at 28 euros not worth considering. The staff are very pleasant and helpful. The room we had on the top floor was good sized, with a great veiw and lovely bathroom. However the was a lot of road noise, and we also had the door of an interconnecting room which wasn't properly sound proofed, so we could hear the intimate concerns of our neighbours. Our bed was small and firm. really letting the room down. There was room for a bigger bed. At 500 euro for 2 nights room only, is is an expensive stay, and not really worth the money

Reviews.Title: “Great location & service and we had a good stay overall”
Reviews.Author: psh1953
Reviews.Content: Banke has an amazing sense of grandeur as you arrive with a huge domed entrance hall - well as you may have guessed yes it was once a bank. This huge open space extends floor to the roof which means that the galleried bedrooms can be on the small side as noted by a number of reviewers tho yes par for course in Paris unless you book a suite or the mid option rooms. You therefore have to feel a bit let down after the initial wow factor of such a spacious and open reception area but our executive room,though indeed on the small side, was well appointed enough. Having read reviews about maintenance yes I noticed a few minor niggles like a shaving mirror was missing in the bathroom leaving a bare looking stalk dangling in space and they'd obviously been some sort of shower fitting once at some point but now missing too. The incloset lighting also didnt work and these are not things I would frankly expect given the room rates but were hardly nough to make me want to shift room. Where the hotel does step up to the mark is the reception and concierge services which were very polite, helpful and very efficient. Likewise the breakfast downstairs is very good and again good nicely attentive service. As with many 4/5 star hotel the lobby bar / room service charges are quite a bit higher than I think is reasonable so we didnt avail of these and it baffles me why such hotels seem quite happy to see me spend my cash elsewhere which is what we did. If you have luggage (or are a wheel chair user) its easier to take a cab to and from Gare du Nord as the Metro service often involves going up stairs etc

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, good location for shopping, no complaints.”
Reviews.Author: JTFBrussels
Reviews.Content: Came here for a weekend. Hotel is easy to reach from Gare Du Nord, as you walk about 5 minutes to the metro line it is on and then two stops later you are there. Impressive lobby, rooms were very well designed, small but seemed large due to the layout. Very quiet, slept well. Automatic lighting in the closet area was a plus and very convenient, would like the same at my place. Seemed to be a good value for the area. Conceriege was helpul, would recommend the restaurante Petite Riche that is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel in the center of Paris”
Reviews.Author: CooperSJCW
Reviews.Content: This is my first stay at the Banke hotel and it was OK. Not good nor bad. Even though it was a business trip, I chose this hotel since it is in the center of Paris and walking distance to Champs Elysees and other attractions. The room itself was small (typical Paris) but modern. Overall the ammenities were alright, but the room felt very used. Several stains on the floor, bed, table, etc... I don't know when it was refurbished, but it will refurbishment very soon. Other than that, everything was OK and nothing out of the ordinary. A bit expensive for what you pay for, but it is Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A big surprise!”
Reviews.Author: LaPadrona
Reviews.Content: In the past 4 years, I have visited Paris 13 times. (I know, lucky Me!) Prior to 2007, I used to frequent the same 2 hotels out of complacency, but then I decided to liven things up and try a different hotel each trip. What fun, non? And always a surprise. My stay at the Banke was indeed a high point in my game of hotel roulette. Here are the many reasons why: 1. much to my surprise I loved the location! Easy to everything. 2. The restoration was very well done and I'm an art historian 3. The price was astonishingly low 4. Great staff and service. 5. Nice breakfast and finally, my room and bath were enormous by Parisian standards. This one definitely goes onto the short list!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Room”
Reviews.Author: nabrubus
Reviews.Content: Hotel Banke was the third hotel we stayed in on our recent trip to France and was by far our least favorite. The hotel is well designed, but unfortunately we found the rooms to be dirty and poorly maintained. When we dropped our bags off in the room we noticed stains on the duvet cover (yes, they looked like THOSE kind of stains) so we asked the front desk on our way out to have the duvet changed while we were at dinner. When we returned from dinner the bed had been turned down but the stained duvet was still in place. We called the front desk and they sent a bellman up with a new duvet right away. Then I went into the bathroom to take a shower and saw probably the dirtiest shower I have ever encountered in a hotel. The grout between the tiles was discolored, dirty, and stained, but even worse there was black mold growing on the surface of the tiles! If the tile had even been wiped down with a sponge there wouldn't be mold on the surface, so you can imagine how dirty that shower must have been! I took pictures we contacted the front desk and requested a room move. We also asked to see the new room to be sure we weren't just going to another dirty room. We were told there were no rooms available for us. After a few minutes we called back and asked about a refund so we could move to another hotel. They said they'd call us back and they soon did saying they had a new room for us. They ended up moving us to a suite, which was nice of them, but really all we wanted was a clean room. The suite was nice, but had peeling caulk, soap scum on the marble tiles, burn holes in the sheets, and other issues that showed a lack of attention to detail. This hotel has a lot of potential, but they really need to be paying better attention to cleanliness and maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again - professional and clean”
Reviews.Author: tappz
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in 2 different hotels while holidaying in Paris, including the Banke. The rate for the second hotel was less, however, in hindsight I wished we had paid slightly more and remained on at the Banke for a number of reasons: *Professional staff: All staff, including reception, restaurant (breakfast and dinner) and cleaning were extremely helpful and knowledgeable. Staff engaged with guests e.g. a consistent friendly greeting and acknowledgement whenever we passed by. Numerous times we approached staff for assistance and on eash occasion they very obligingly offered up help. Unlike other accommodation, staff didn't huddle, talk among themselves and appear aloofish. On the contrary, all staff we met engaged with us in a professional manner (without being intrusive) and were happy to share with us if we chose to. *Room size: We stayed in a standard double room. The rooms as stated by alot of reviewers, are small. However, not too small that we didn't have sufficient room to move with 2 large suitcases. I like space but didnt feel cramped at any time. The cleanliness, nice linen and modern-ness made up for the reduced space versus the 35sqm (standard) rooms we are used to in the Pacific (New Zealand). *Breakfast: Of all breakfasts served on this trip - the Banke breakfast was the best. Without sounding cliche-like, all food was fresh! The croissants were absolutely!fresh - buttery and flakey. I didn't bother with these at other establishments as they didn't come close to the freshness of the Banke pastries. The breakfast staff were super-efficient and there was very little delay waiting for eggs of choice, toast and coffee to be served. The remaining breakfast items e.g. cereals, fruits and pastries were available buffet style. *Location: This hotel is perfectly located to easy access to the big Department stores (3 minute walk) e.g. La Fayette and Print-temps and loads of Cafes - yummy crepe cafe right across the road. Our favourite was Rivoli (2 minute walk away). Alot of tourists frequent this cafe but not so much that it lost its feeling of 'local'. Reasonable priced meals and able to stroll on in up to 10:00pm. Our first few days were spent adjusting/catching up on french time so we would wake at 9:00pm and stroll on out to our fave. A 5 minute walk to Musee Opera. We have been lucky enough to stay in many hotels over the past years. Although cleanliness is a priority it does make a difference to stay in a property that exudes style and flair, subsequently, I usually look for 4-5 star accommodation. In this instance Banke met my expectations and feel their rates fairly reflect the property/service provided. Although, the bigger attractions i.e. Notre Dame, Eiffel and Louvre are not located closely to the Opera district, I felt this was a nice location that still manages to retain a 'local' feel despite the many tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: londoner-reviews
Reviews.Content: The location of Hotel Banke is perfect - close to shops, restaurants and sightseeing. We walked almost everywhere by foot. The hotel itself is almost TOO glamorous, and there were hardly any other guests when we stayed there. Our room was very clean and spacious with a nice view, however the bathroom door was flimsy and broken, plus it's frosted glass so you can essentially see and hear everything that goes on behind the door! The staff were not exactly friendly or welcoming, but this didn't really bother us too much. On the whole, we would definitely come again. Last Minute has some fantastic deals for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful 4 star hotel very well located”
Reviews.Author: Pete7_Zug
Reviews.Content: Very well located 4-star hotel (would also pass as a 5-star) in a former building of a bank. Decoration with good taste. Seems to have been renovated not too long ago. Rooms good size and also very clean. Friendly staff. Would definitively return again and recommend to anyone, either for business or holiday purposes.

Reviews.Title: “The Banke hotel was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Jenni_In_AZ
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here in August 2011 and had a great experience. The Standard room was plenty big enough for the two of us. There was a spacious closet (with a safe) and a really nice bathroom. The hotel staff was very friendly and attentive. The location was great- close to the metro and walking distance to many great attractions. Compared to other hotels I have stayed at in Paris, this one impressed me with the cleanliness, quality of service, spacious rooms, and boutique hotel vibe. My only caution would be to watch out for the price of champagne in the mini bar. The small bottle was 40 Euros! This was the first time we didn't check prices before we drank from the mini bar... Lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: “Disgraceful comments”
Reviews.Author: Dublintwinkle
Reviews.Content: I am really shocked, have just read some of the management comments on guests feedback and I think it's dreadful. One guest was told they would rather if he did not return! I am trying to bear in mind there be something lost in translation but the bottom line is if you are in the service industry you treat your guests with respect. There are ways of responsing to problems but this hotel are not doing that. I stayed in the hotel, we were the first ever guests to stay, I enjoyed my time there but being honest I would not now go back having read the feedback. I think it's entirely unprofessional and if management behave like this I dread to think what other staff members do. You are not doing yourselves any favours but posting comments like you are

Reviews.Title: “Okay but you'd better have deep pockets......”
Reviews.Author: ToscatheCat
Reviews.Content: On the whole this was an ok stay at this hotel. I am surprised by some of the comments on here, the staff we dealt with were very pleasant. The room was large, modern and comfortable, and had excellent free wifi. Down sides: No iron in the room, The utterly exorbitant bar costs. £40 for 2 pints of Kronenbourg is outrageous even by Parisian standards. I would stay again but only is work is paying!

Reviews.Title: “Fourth visit since I last reviewed....”
Reviews.Author: Sun Lounge Lizard
Reviews.Content: We are still having a lovely romance with Hotel Banke, and can say that in the 15 months we have now been visiting and just back from our fourth stay, we still love it. For anyone who is unfamiliar with Paris, you very rarely get hotels with big rooms, and for a hotel that has been converted from - well - a bank it is pretty obvious small rooms will be the norm. They do have some larger ones, and if you prefer a big room, then it is probably best to check out the standard you are booking first so avoid being disappointed. We have always stayed for two nights in a standard room and found it perfectly fine, as we are usually out most of the day. On our last stay we were there for longer so opted to pay a bit more for a bigger room. Of course it is expensive to eat and drink in the hotel - as it is virtually anywhere in the Euro zone these days, I would recommend anyone staying who is concerned with the price of a breakfast to venture out of the hotel, walk down the Rue Lafayette for five minutes in the direction of the Gare du Nord, to General Lafayette, get yourself a table outside, a coffee and a croissant and watch the Parisian world go by. It is such a waste to sit in a hotel restaurant, in any big city, you could just about be anywhere in the world. There is a photo on the site from a previous review which has 'dark, scary corridors', poor them, they have completely missed the point of a boutique hotel with subdued lighting. One tip.....We have over our four stays got better in speeding up our journey. If you have taken Eurostar, and have only got hand luggage you can walk to the hotel in about 15 minutes. You can actually stand in the taxi queue for that long, and then as the hotel is on a one way street you end up going the long way round, so if it it at a busy time of the day, your journey can take almost half an hour. We now walk it and enjoy stretching our legs after being on the train for a couple of hours.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad and the ugly”
Reviews.Author: RTabi
Reviews.Content: The good: my room was quite nice decorated and, the location. The bad: no irons available, no adaptors available, no coffee or tea facilities. Poorly indicated room allocation, broken and dusty lift. The ugly: Surly, unhelpful staff (you can understand if you read the answer from the General Manager to the guest comments @ tripadvisor). Really rude and arrogant front desk staff, bad haircut, broken nails and the usual chewing gum....very elegant indeed. We were waiting for talk to the manager and we, finally go, after 35 minutes, because he was so occupied talking and talking at the phone in the hotel's lobby. I was there last week and I will never come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and elegant”
Reviews.Author: DBOnline
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with my partner and our dog in June. Location is perfect in the heart of the shopping district ad 10 minutes walk from the Louvre. Room is small which is to be expected from Paris. Excellent bed, bathroom and amenities. Staff are friendly and quite efficient. Only gripe was on check in we were told breakfast was included, but when we were half way through breakfast on day 1 they gave us a bill. When they realised it was their mistake they gave us the first breakfast free but wanted to charge for other days. It is not worth €26 euros as it is a reasonable choice but not vast with limited hot selections. €20 a night for the dog which we weren't told in advance as well. The restaurant only serves meals in very limited time periods. Would definitely stay again depending on the rate being offered at the time.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service and good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Mmvillanueva
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good the rooms are very spacious and clean and the best part you couldn’t hear any noise from the outside street. I went there for work and upon my arrival my room was not ready because I arrived too early but the staff quickly offered a solution and gave me a different room. My mom joined me on this trip and while I was working the staff took really good care of her helping her out they even spoke Spanish which was a great help! At the end of the trip she knew everyone which made her feel very comfortable. The location is great just a couple blocks from Galerie Lafayette and within walking distance to a major metro station. I really don’t have any major problems with this hotel maybe the breakfast price was a bit high but there is plenty of places you can go close. I go to Paris for work often and I will definitely come back to Hotel Banke.

Reviews.Title: “Poor to average at best”
Reviews.Author: Boros
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Banke for Eurohedge, and its proximity to the bourse was the only positive aspect of our stay. Its photographers have clearly used wide-angle lenses liberally - the hotel was much pokier than one is led to believe from its website. The rooms are surprisingly small, think of a double bed with a foot either side and a few feet of a sitting area. The staff are a mixed bunch with friendly bell-boys and waiters, yet a laughably insincere front-desk. On checking in, our SLH Amex offer of an upgrade wasn't available due to capacity issues but upon stumping up some cash for an upgrade the computer miraculously found some available rooms. The bottom line is that this is a three star hotel at a five star price and if one is used to staying at the Westin or its like then the Banke will be a disappointment. Its restaurant Josephin deserves a separate visit but I will be steering clear of this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Rats in the bar, disputed charge on my credit card”
Reviews.Author: milena_dj
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 times in total in this hotel as the location is convenient. Each time it was worse and worse. It culminated last time when we saw rats running in the bar while bartender was totally calm saying that it is quite normal. Finally, the charged me for mini bar that I didn't touch 2 days after I arrived back home. I disputed the charge, but they claim that they can do it based on my pre-authorization for the mini-bar. To cut the long story short: there are much better charming hotels in Opera neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, OK room”
Reviews.Author: Belly2007
Reviews.Content: Pros: - You're in the Opera area, near Galeries Lafayette, Opera Garnier, lots of restaurants nearby - Rooms are new and clean - Modern design - Free wifi - Shower in a separate room and toilet in another so my husband and I can do our 'toilet stuff' at the same time - Good service by the staff! Cons: - The waterproofing of the partial shower door wasn't sealed well enough and so water would escape during a shower and wet the floors (and my slippers!) - Bed is queen sized - Small sized room (but I think all Paris hotels are this size) - Airconditioning not cool; we tried to open the window but it's such that when you open it, it shuts after as there is no hinge / stopper. - entrance to the hotel is a set of 5-8 steps, meaning you'd have to lug your luggage up through these (no ramp) All in all, would stay here again for the convenience and the great price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute of our stay”
Reviews.Author: ML1987
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed with Banke for a couple of nights and found ourselves sad to leave! Hotel Banke is one of a kind. The staff is great and the rooms are immaculate. Upon arrival we even received a free upgrade to a Deluxe Room. The service is just fantastic, I left my headphones in the room upon departure, one phone call and a week later I found them in my mailbox, back in Perth. I can only speak good of this hotel and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff! Too expensive!”
Reviews.Author: brandeetucker11
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and all of the hotels that were recommended were sold out. So, we chose Hotel Banke because of the great reviews on TripAdvisor. We had an Executive Suite, which was super small compared to ANY other hotel room we've stayed in, including those in India, Spain, South of France or New York. But, it was cute, comfy and clean. We took a peak into one of the "regular" rooms and it looked like all that fit in there was a bed, so... I guess we lucked out. But, for the price, I can't help but wonder if we could have done better. We ordered room service- two bottles of water and two glasses of orange juice and the total was 38 euros! We opted out of the 28 euro breakfast because we heard that the breakfast wasn't good enough to pay that much. The location was great! But, not sure if it matters where you stay in Paris because it is so easy to get around by walking, by taxi, by using the Metro system and/or by taking the bus - once you figure out the routes. The hotel is beautiful, but not necessarily as grand as they make it look in the photos, I've seen better. It looked like a lot of business travelers use this hotel, we're a young couple from Los Angeles, CA so, we definitely stuck out like a sore thumb. But, it worked. The employees are very sweet and EXTREMELY helpful!! So, overall Hotel Banke is an overpriced hotel with a great staff.

Reviews.Title: “modern hotel at great location on Paris 9th”
Reviews.Author: jay_fra
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at Radisson Blu on Bld. Haussmann, but wanted to have a change and booked Hotel Banke. I am impressed with the friendliness of the hotel team (everyone from bellboy to reception, from barmen to housekeeping), the luxurious settings, the art displays on the floors. The hotel truly deserves to be part of "the Small Luxury Hotels of the World" group. The rooms are not very large, but enough to have a comfortable evening. I particularly liked the walk-in closet and the mosaic bathrooms. From now on, I only want to stay at this opulent ex-Bank when I am in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: DaimosLA
Reviews.Content: Decided to book this hotel as recommended by a travel magazine. It was a great a great decision. After booking, I emailed the hotel and told them that my partner and I are visiting for our anniversary and that we wanted to have a room on the 6th floor with a view of Montmarte. Instead, upon check-in, the front desk has informed us that they held two rooms so that we can decide which one we like better so that we can have a memorable stay. How's that for attention to detail? And unlike other hotels, our linens were changed daily! My partner even said, he's okay to sleep in the bathroom - it's that big. Special mention to the front desk for being so helpful in booking restaurants and giving us restaurant recommendation, most especially Juan and the bellhop team! And did mention FREE WiFi? So, until our next anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything”
Reviews.Author: Ella91
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night and enjoyed the stay. The room was clean and good quality, so was breakfast next morning. The reception service was really good for a Parisian hotel and they spoke good English. I got a good night sleep even though there's a popular bar on the ground floor. The best thing is the location: just close to Opera, the department stores and metro stations. Coming back to this hotel next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for top quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: ReadingSwallows
Reviews.Content: This hotel is elegant in a quirky way. Great deal via Eurostar. Dim corridors, brown leather, very masculine feel, but with quirky feminine diamante touches where you least expect it. Great for short break - don't bring much luggage as it will not fit into the bijou-sized rooms. We skipped the 28 euro breakfast and ate very well for 6 Euros in nearby sandwich bar. Totally convenient for walking to sights, or take Metro less than 100 yards away. Bathroom tiny (typical in Paris) but has all you need and loo is separate. We found the room a bit hot and stuffy and opening window let the street noise in so we put up with this.

Reviews.Title: “Nice sleep and good breakfast, but reception staff unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: kirklandgirl02
Reviews.Content: The people who worked at front desk were not very friendly. We did get our room, but obviously they did not about the SLH details, and were trying to charge us extra. We had some really frustrating conversations! The room was clean and nice, but small. The breakfast was delicious. It was not the most extensive selection but delicious. And the waiters were really helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location, but food & drink VERY expensive!”
Reviews.Author: Renork
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Banke in Paris for 2 nights and generally really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is a beautifully restored building in the Opera district, about 20 minutes walk from Gare du Nord (which is really convenient if you come in by Eurostar) and the rooms are fully sound-proofed and very comfortable. We travelled with our toddler and the staff gave us a room on the lowest floor (so that the baby monitor would work in the restaurant) and provided a travel cot. However, the weekend was a bit spoilt by two things. One being the air-conditioning in our room, which refused to work properly despite an engineer trying to fix it - the temperature reached almost 27 degrees during the night,. which made things quite uncomfortable. We had to open the window, which sort of defeated the whole point of soundproofing and did affect our sleep quality. The second, and more important, thing was the cost of food & drink at the hotel. On the first night we ordered a (very) small beer and a lemonade at the bar, and paid 20 Euros! Our evening meal, without wine, cost almost 150 Euros. Breakfast is 56 Euros for two people, without any hot dishes included (and goes up to 64 Euros for a continental room service breakfast). We just felt that the prices were really steep for what was provided. The food in the restaurant was good, but the tables were very close together, the seats not particularly comfortable, and the music from the bar was so loud you had to raise your voice to have a conversation. Happy to pay a fair bit for something really special but, as far as the food & drinks were concerned, this just felt like a massive mark-up on something that was just average. Having said that, the staff are lovely and we did have a really nice time overall. Not sure I would recommend it for a family with young children, because it's much more of a chic boutique type place (with no highchairs in the breakfast restaurant), but the location is excellent for shopping & sightseeing. [Have rated it average overall, because of the cost - otherwise (even with the air-conditioning issue) it would have been good.]

Reviews.Title: “excellent quality”
Reviews.Author: ok11London
Reviews.Content: Good location, bit expensive but the quality is amazing. Rooms are very clean and modern. Free wifi. excellent breakfast but a bit expensive. helpful staff. I am staying there again because i really enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: PUREFX
Reviews.Content: Free Wifi in the room is always a winner. Breakfast was a highlight with a good selection of high quality food. Very nice fresh fruit including strawberries. Very good coffee and fresh OJ. Amazing lomo and spanish ham. They have concentrated on producing a selection of really nice food rather than lots of average food. Dont worry there is plenty to eat. A very clean modern beautiful hotel, and new with nice sheets. The exec room was a good size but the standard was on the small size. Would I stay again, yes.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL EXCELLENT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: alpaWestSussex
Reviews.Content: Good clean modern hotel,excellent location with good staff. Large room with nice seating area. Large bathroom with plenty of toiletries, fluffy bathrobes and slippers - just what you need after a day visiting the sights! Although our room was large, we did notice when looking on the floor plan that rooms were various sizes,so i guess we were lucky being allocated a larger room! Good selection of food available for breakfast,also section of hot items available. Hotel is located near to two metro stations and a short cab ride from the main line station, you could easily walk to the hotel,but at the moment road improvements are being carried out so it is probably easier to take a cab.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: paalSussex
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in this lovely hotel. Friendly welcome from staff. Had very spacious room, with very large bathroom on fifth floor. Hotel and room very clean. Breakfast was in the basement with good selection of food from the buffet breakfast bar, hot items were available, but had to ask for these, as the menu was on table, but was not asked if we wanted them on first morning. Good quality but expensive! Excellent location 20 mins walking from eurostar station and 2 mins from metro, so easy to get to all the sights. Would return to this hotel if visiting Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Very "Fashion" and slightly over the top, I was expected a lot more!”
Reviews.Author: MikePM
Reviews.Content: This hotel is part of the group, based mainlyin Barcelona, Madrid & Paris. Been part of the Small Luxury Hotel of the world, I was looking for this stay. The overall building is fantastic (an old Bank), the main foyer superb (although quite over the top and too fashion according to my taste). The front desk is poorly indicated, the lighting is very low throughout the entire Hotel (Lift, main foyer, rooms...). The room are very small (15m2??), with some silly wardrobe (you can not hag a trousers properly). The bathroom amenities are on the cheap side. Overall the hotel is correct but again I was expecting a lot more. The breakfast was average. Good points: + Location. + Efficiency + Part of the Small Luxury hotel of the world (upgrade/Breakfeast..) + A free welcome drink/cocktail at the bar. + Polite and friendly staff. Bad points: - No Staff uniforms (again pretending to be cool/fashion?) - Room are way too small. - Poor wardrobe layout & no Iron Board. - Poor selection of bathroom amenities (You would expect Hermes or Roger & Gallet for example) - Way too fancy, restaurant. - Low lighting & no real atmosphere/soul. - No real concierge service. - Average Breakfast (Spanish type/selection).

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: AJ183
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 3 day stay at the Banke Hotel, which deserves a much higher tripadvisor rating than its current one. From the moment we entered the beautiful red and gold lobby we felt that we were somewhere special (check out the snakeskin-print toilets off the lobby!). The rooms were incredibly stylish in a way you don't often see in a hotel in this price range, but also comfortable and quiet with a decent amount of space in the executive room and a separate toilet and bathroom. Our only criticism was that the bar in the lobby was very expensive and didn't seem to have much atmosphere but we had a wonderful stay and would definitely recommend it and would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service all the way”
Reviews.Author: Vladimirus
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I came to Paris on our regular trip to Paris fashion week, and booked the this amazing hotel through small luxury hotels of the world, and it is truly a priceless gem and this beautiful city. It's really hard to open something in Paris and have everyone talk about it. From the minute you arrive the staff of the hotel make fell like you are the only person staying. We had the pleasure of stating the suit 106 on the first floor which possibly is the key room of the hotel AMAZING. From the front desk to the breakfast people, the concierge to the Boys getting you taxi's. This hotel is really aware of what it's all about. We are looking forward to coming back anytime soon. To all the staff at the hotel Banke, thank you for making us fell at home. If there was a little finger to put somewhere it would be a courtesy car at disposal. Vladimir Vladimir

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel w/contemporary art in great location, but very cold, uninterested staff and overpriced, minimalistic rooms”
Reviews.Author: EddieFP
Reviews.Content: Public mystery guest visit report - Dark lighting, bold modern furnishings and texture with the original stone block walls. Mosaic flooring in the foyer area, marble beams. Black chairs, black lift – everything is dark. No natural light. - Hotel could use fresh flowers in the foyer area as it is very cold and bland. The lounge is too open and does not feel relaxing as the seats are uncomfortable. - Lobby includes abstract, contemporary art-deco objects with strong colours used – red and black. - As with the ceiling height the building naturally feels cold and there has not been enough done to make the atmosphere relaxing and comfortable as the colour scheme is too bold. This ‘cold’ feeling goes on in the hallways and rooms. This is due to the lack of classic furnishings and texture – the interior is too corporate and dense. - Rooms are very modern and remind of a hotel chain as there is not much personality in the rooms. Some of the suites have a small walk-way balcony. The beds are white linen with 2 pillows and a bed-spread, no cushions. Although attractive, rooms are basic and very minimalistic and do not provide a luxurious feel. The hotel is too corporate and does not reflect a Parisian establishment but that of a chain, which it is, a Spanish chain. - There is a small spa/sauna with a very small fitness; however the area is not very private in its location of the hotel – first floor. - The breakfast area resembles a luxurious modern eating area – goes around in a circle. Fresh fruit and pastries on offer with the option of an American breakfast. However, as there is a hostess ticking guests’ names off, she does not escort guests to a table nor does she explain how the menu works. Very confusing and frustrating for guests. - During our stay, there was filming taking place in the main lobby of the hotel and there were many cables etc. thus had to be careful when walking in and out. - Although staff is polite, they are slow and somewhat young and naïve. A bit unprofessional and not completely sincere when dealing with guests; they seem very business like and do not seem to pursue good customer relationships. Furthermore, porters at the front entrance of the hotel seemed slack, uninterested, young and not maintaining professional posture. Their attire is completely inappropriate as it resembles a casual security look, not suits, and they were wearing trainers! Not exactly the image you would expect for a hotel that advertises itself as ‘4-star superior’. Also, the hotel could benefit from small trees outside the main entrance as it is very plain and not totally recognisable as a hotel. - The general vibe from this hotel is very urban, cold and dense. The hotel does not reflect an empire-luxurious hotel nor would you know you were in the heart of Paris… In my opinion, it is far too overpriced (rack rates standard single 475 euros, standard double 580 euros, executive 685 euros, deluxe 970 euros, junior suite 1722 euros), it does not have an overwhelming hospitable environment, there is too much open empty space in the foyer area and the rooms are small. The building is beautiful, however, it has not been effectively decorated to provide a luxurious environment to guests; there is no identity. Staff should pay more attention to their clients as this is poignant to the overall experience. The staff attire should be changed to reflect a 4-star establishment in a fashionable area as this.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room lovely location lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: clancypee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 5 nights in Sept 2010. Great location-close to everything. Beautiful room with a very comfy bed. Blackout curtains and thick windows ensured a great nights sleep. Breakfast was included and was superb. The breakfast room was run like a well oiled machine. Eggs-cooked to order, fresh juice, smiling staff. All the staff were very friendly and no request was too much. Plus they all spoke English that was better than my French. Look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Want to Leave”
Reviews.Author: Choo_lover
Reviews.Content: After finishing a 16 day tour around Europe staying in questionable levels of accommodation I was immensely looking forward to my 4 day stay in Paris. I arrived at the Hotel Banke with the biggest smile on my face. This hotel was everything that I had imagined and extensively read about! It was chic, swanky, the staff were very exceptionally friendly and nothing was too much trouble. Travelling solo I felt very safe, the room was spacious and the bathroom was particularly large for a Parisien hotel. The location was superb - having the Opera building as a landmark, the metro station close by and some of the best shopping in Paris only a couple of minutes walk away was fantastic. I didn't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean and nice!”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter4Ever75
Reviews.Content: Great hotel that offers that litte special ambiance, super location and nice staff. Great rates through my travel agent www.traveldesign.se.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously overrated”
Reviews.Author: happysuze
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 13 nights, initially as private guests and for the last 10 nights as members of a tour group. If this hadn't been the case, we would have left after the first night. All the staff wore suits and with one or two exceptions, there was no friendliness. My coeliac condition was ignored and after several days I was able to purchase suitable breakfast items (in a store I found by accident) which the kitchen staff took from me. Eventhough I was assured the other staff would be informed of my needs, each morning I had the same battle to be given the foods which I had supplied! Our queen room was very, very small and the cupboards were not big enough to hold more than a day's worth of clothes. There was nowhere to store the suitcases and as we had to leave many clothing items in the cases, we couldn't ask the hotel to store them for us. We sqeezed the cases into the toilet area! The hotel was in a great location being very close to 2 Metro lines yet within easy walking distance of l'Opera, Champs Elysee and the Louvre. Does this make it worth over $350AUD per night? Maybe, but in Paris there are much better hotels a little further away and a short Metro ride from the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonUna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last weekend, a group of six females. On first impressions we were very impressed. Lovely lobby, decor impressive. We found the front of house staff to be extremely friendly, especially the staff who waited around the doors to help with bags and taxis etc. They were helpful with directions and never once did they give the impression that they were doing it for tips - service with a smile. The bedrooms are small but that is no unusual for Paris. Beds very comfortable and the bathrooms small but lovely, very clean and modern with a good shower and plenty of towels. The bathroom accessories in a little presentation bag were a lovely touch. The two barmen who worked the bar on the two nights that we came back for a nightcap were friendly and efficient. I will definately recommend this hotel to friends and I would stay here again on my next trip. Location is great, very central and within walking distance to most sights.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but could be better”
Reviews.Author: blackbird68
Reviews.Content: Very nice interiour and room. The Suite seems to be lot more smaller then on the Photos of their website. The Receptionists are terrible, unfriendly and inefficient. They did a reservation on my CC but wanted to charge me extra. I really do not like that. They also let us wait 15 minutes beside one other customer for check out, they ordered the Taxi half an hour to early. The total opposite were the staff in the front, luggage, portiers those were friendly and helpful and very kind and did a perfect service!! The Rooms were clean. All in one very good with the only exception of the Reception Staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, perfect location, memorable Parisian experience!!”
Reviews.Author: AGA1234
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Banke over 3 days in late December. The hotel is amazingly located, and that is probably it's most unique feature. Right off the bat, you can take the RoissyBus from CDG to the opera district, and the hotel is then 2 blocks away from the bus stop. This is for sure the easiest and most affordable (9 euro) way to practically go door to door from the airport to your hotel! And then no matter where you want to go in Paris, the hotel is never more than a little walk to your destination or to the metro. Cab stand right around the corner as well. Probably a 15 minute walk to the Louvre, 20 minute to Champs-Elysses, and 10 minute up to Sacre Coeur. The lobby is gorgeous and staff were ready to help with bags, printing out walking directions, finding cabs, and even providing umbrellas in the rain/snow. Booked a standard room and it was great. Fit myself and my spouse perfectly, little love seat, ample closet space, comfy bed, minibar, and bath with tub and also freestanding shower. Best of all was the view from our window, overlooking the monmarte and with the Sacre Coeur just to the right. No noise problems, slept almost too well!! Great little hotel, lots of amenities and comforts for a great rate. Free WiFi as well! Felt like a 5 star hotel, though the price was 2 star!

Reviews.Title: “The superlatives are well-deserved”
Reviews.Author: JuliaVanderbilt
Reviews.Content: If you read the past reviews, you will notice how management of this hotel, notably Mr. Xavi Vega, makes it a point to respond to both praise and criticism. It was this attention to customer service that first piqued my curiosity and had me booking eventually. I said, if top management pays this much attention to Tripadvisor, surely they take well care of their guests indeed. I was not wrong. On arrival, Mr. Xavi Vega met us in the lobby for a very warm and friendly welcome. His staff were notably swift and helpful and we were upgraded to a deluxe room that overlooked the bustling street. The room was large, immaculate and charming, with an artistic flair that matched the legendary lobby. Space is obviously at a premium in Paris, so all that legroom was very much appreciated. The malachite green bathroom is serviceable and was a tad cold in design and feeling for my taste; but that's a minor point to the overall cleanliness of the place. The room might also use a few more lights or stronger lamps; the wan winter light of January begs for a bit more illumination. Free WiFi worked very well the entire time we were there. I had stayed the week before New Year's in a hotel around the Trocadero area...how I wish I had opted for this hotel earlier! The location is central and lively; it is a stone throw away from the department stores, perfect for our last few days in Europe for much needed retail therapy. The front desk were very helpful in giving suggestions on where to eat and where to go; they recommended Le Petit Riche for our last evening and it was a divine experience. There are plenty of cafes around the area too and the busy, festive Opera is around the corner for even more choices. We walked to most places, enjoying the hotel's central location, whether it was to the Vendome, the Louvre or the Tuileries. On rainy days, the guys at the door front were quick to offer an umbrella. Check out was swift and orderly. We decided to save a bit of our buck for the trip to the airport, opting to walk to the Roissy Airport Shuttle which was 5 min. away. I think it's a great idea as it only cost 9.80 euro per person, compared to what you'd have to pay on a taxi or even a shared shuttle. All said, I think Mr. Vega runs a tight ship; his efforts polish the hotel to spanking shine and the hotel justly deserves it's rising ranks on Travel+Leisure and Tripadvisor. Definitely worth another stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Vassilios_11
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel, although it is 4 star, it offers the amenities of a 5 star hotel. It is highly recommended. The staff is very helpful at any question. The breakfast, although there was not too much variety, what existed was qualitative. The room was perfect, but a little bit small. Τhere were slippers, bathrobe shampoos and etc.The facilities were great. What impressed me was that every day, they left at the hotel room the tomorrow's weather Forecast with 2 chocolates!!Congratulations to all the staff for their help!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Rubyduby1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January and the hotel was superb. Before we arrived my partner had emailed the hotel asking for restaurant suggestions as it was my birthday while we were there and we wanted somewhere good. When we arrived reception informed us that they had upgraded us from a double room to a suite free of charge, I presume because of my birthday. The room was amazing, it was really big and very luxurious, we were delighted with it. The hotel reception area and bar was also gorgeous. The staff were so helpful and couldn't do enough for you and the free wifi came in useful. There is also a computer in reception that you can use free of charge. The only thing missing from the hotel was coffee making facilities in the room - we missed this first thing in a morning. We didn't pay for breakfast at the hotel because it was very pricey but there are a couple of nice cafes across the road, one selling crepes and the other, Chez Jean, you could get a croissant, eggs, fresh orange and a coffee for 5 euros. If we ever come back to Paris we will definitely stay at this hotel again - it was in a good area, we walked the whole of Paris and the location of the hotel was ideal to do this. There was also lots of cafes and restaurants near by.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Very Chic”
Reviews.Author: dcalexander1
Reviews.Content: The lobby is beautiful-very trendy. The staff was freindly and helpful. It is less than a 5 min, walk to the metro. Plenty of dining options and shopping surrounds the hotel. My negatives: the hotel is dark-very dim lighting, the bar is overpriced-good but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a Comfortable Bed!”
Reviews.Author: LeighBCD
Reviews.Content: Hotel Banke is in a great location close to Galeries Lafayette. It would be a perfect bolt hole for a coupley weekend in Paris. The decor reminded me of the W hotel chain and the "boutique" feel is comforting especially on a dark and rainy winters night. Breakfast was very good, the only (smallish) complaint was I could not find any eggs on the buffer, not even hard boiled ones. But hey, this is France and that is not part of the breakfast culture so you have to go with the flow!. I would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, price quality”
Reviews.Author: Sporting2000
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is by far the best attribute, just 5 min walking to Opera and Gallerie Lafeytte. Room was also great, both in size and cleanliless (it was a suite), with the exception of the bathroom (very cold). The amenities pack was also great. This hotel has everything to be excellent but fails in service, most notably in the personalization of service. I asked for restaurant suggestions by email before going to Paris and I never received an anwswer. I had several problems booking a table in a restaurant,...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmt2311
Reviews.Content: Visited Paris for a weekend, stayed at Hotel Banke after reading trip advisor reviews. Great first impression, very cool and trendy, fabulous decor. Got an upgrade to a superior room which was a treat. Very comfortable with a spacious bathroom, all very clean and superbly furnished, (leather chaise longue, leather rug,atmospheric lighting). Staff are very low key, polite and helpful. Didn't eat in the restaurant but the bar was good. Only a 10 minute walk to the Louvre etc and we walked back from restaurants every night and felt safe. Very near galleria lafayette. Only downside to the hotel is that breakfast is VERY expensive (not included in room price). We walked out to nearby cafes instead. Would definately book again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but we could not shower!”
Reviews.Author: Errigalclimber
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Banke has a lot going for it. It is an attractive hotel in a very good location not far from Galeries Lafayette. Service is very good and the reception staff are very helpful. One thing slightly marred our stay, in that the sliding glass screen door for the shower of the bath was not just broken, it was completely missing from its hooks (as we found out after using the shower, having not been warned). This meant that on the one occasion we had a shower, the water went all over the marble bathroom floor, which became very slippy - it was very dangerous for our toddler and we used all of our towels to clean up the mess. We were confined to taking baths from then on and the bath fills none too quickly! We reported the problem and were told it would be fixed. It wasn't and we were still charged the full rate for our room. I would not let our experience put you off the hotel as it is very nice and we found the staff very friendly, but the room should not have been made available with a missing shower screen, particularly to a family with a young toddler. Or we should at least have been warned about it and given the opportunity to ask for an alternative room. We should have made more of a fuss about it, but we did not like to complain.

Reviews.Title: “central hotel”
Reviews.Author: xalara
Reviews.Content: Artistic and fun design and environment without compromising comfort and relaxation.The staff at the reception has been very helpful, spoke good English. Very close to metro , shops and ear Opera and Galeries Lafayette.Pleasant breakfast room and staff.I wish that breakfast was included in the rate. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 4 Star Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JJBlondie
Reviews.Content: My husband and some friends stayed at this four star hotel in the Opera District or the 9th arrondissement of Paris for 3 nights in late September. The hotel is new, it opened in Feb 2010. By a billing fluke I got an amazing deal here, which made the stay all the worthwhile. The rooms were small and clean, the beds comfortable, and the bathroom a decent size (separate shower and toilet - which was nice). The hotel bar was expensive (about 12 Euros for a glass of red wine) and the breakfast was too much (25 Euros) when you could walk across the street and get a coffee and crepe for about 6 Euros. The staff spoke English very well and they were helpful and polite. We really enjoyed this hotel and I would highly recommend this to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Mburke4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Banke for 4 nights in early September. We had booked two rooms for our family. We requested the rooms be next to each other and they were. The rooms were rather on the small side, but the amenities were very nice. The bathrooms were beautiful. The bed was very comfortable. On the way home, my daughter realized she lost her wallet. She thought she might have left it at the computer table in the lobby. We called the hotel and they had not found it. When we arrived back home, we called the hotel again to see if they had found it. Amazingly, the cab driver had returned the wallet/purse with everything intact.) There was cash, credit cards, and a brand new camera in the bag. The Hotel Banke emailed and called us to let us know the good news. They also arranged to have the purse shipped to our home in the US. We received the package in three days. We were very happy with the service the hotel provided, and would definitely recommend it to our friends. Thank you Hotel Banke!

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: EliBouMerhi
Reviews.Content: Hotel well located in Paris and near shopping streets, and the metro station. decoration is very artistic, room very efficient and staff are friendly and helpful although we did have a problem with internet, however our experience was very good and I d definitely use this hotel again. great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Whilster
Reviews.Content: Hotel gave a warm welcome and made us feel at home right away. We had a suite, which was large and quiet. The shower and turn down service were real highlights. The bed was so comfy it was tough to get up for sightseeing. Luckily the shopping and sights are walkable. The bar is a great spot to have a pre dinner drink. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “wow great location, great hotel, best part of Paris all a stone throw away!”
Reviews.Author: simmo888
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing! Location Location Location. Its a stone throw from the old opera house and located along La Fayette (where all the shops are). We walked from our hotel to the Lourve, Notre Dame and the Eiffel tower (make sure you pre purchase your Eiffel tower tickets on line or you will be waiting in the longest que ever). The Sienne is also close by and recommended as the route of choice. The resturants in the Hotel are very expensive but very French. You get what you pay for i.e it is very fine dining. I noticed there were local people who were not staying at the hotel also dining there. The rooms are amazing and the hotel foyer is really something. Suggest you google this and check out a few pictures. Anyway the French are nuts about good food. Here are my thoughts... go to La Fayette food department in the shopping centre for brekky, they open at 8.30am (rest of the department store opens at 9.30am) go to level 1 and have a coffee and a pasrty! while you are there pick up a picnic lunch and eat this in the gardens inbetween the Lourve and the Champs Elyees. Many Parisians grab a bottle and picnic dinner to eat along the Sienne.... I know this because we did a river cruise twice!!! Once during the day and once at night... this is a must do. especially at night its only 13 Euros... We made an effort with our limited French (i.e Bonjour) and its amazing how far you can get with a smile. If you are Australian, make it know as soon as possible. The place is full of English and Americians and being Australian is still somewhat still a novelty!!! We'd been warned of dog poo, rats and rude Parisians and did not come across any of these.... wow Paris is a wonderful city, we loved it...... So much so we got engaged there...xxx

Reviews.Title: “Best European City Hotel I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: AP29
Reviews.Content: First off I have to say that my husband and I are quite particular about the hotels we stay in, but we like to try new places and don't always go for 5 star. Based on that, Hotel Banke is a true 4 star hotel - it is amazingly clean and well kept by all the staff and the bedrooms and bathrooms are emaculate - no mould, dirt, funny smells, stains or anything to put us off at all. We stayed in an Executive Room, so cannot comment on the standard rooms. The Exec room we had was an ample size for a few days, but if you are staying for longer then you may want to upgrade for the sake of space and louge space. Although, there was a swivel flat-screen TV on the wall which was great so you could watch TV from any angle, however they only had one chair - very comfortable, but slightly too large for the room. The closet space is good - plenty of hanging space and shelves for shoes etc, which is very handy. I liked the way it was hidden away in the wall! The toilet is separate from the combo bath/shower and sink - I think that is such a useful feature when you are sharing a room and it even had it's own little sink. You can leave your toiletries at home too, as the hotel provide them all, albeit own-brand. Beds were very comfy too and you get nice slippers and robes to slip into. The staff are all very friendly and helpful and cannot do enough for you - especially Jose the doorman! He gave us an umbrella and map on our first day - very thoughtful! Now, the restaurant 'Josefin' - that deserves it's own review! It's pricey, but everywhere in Paris is to be honest, however the food is to die for! Please have at least one meal there whilst staying at the hotel, you won't be disappointed, it really is worth the money. Overall, great city hotel in a good location and I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Great - But whats with the eggs and tea?”
Reviews.Author: Aucklandkiwis1
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay, Most the staff were very friendly and helpful, the bathroom could have been cleaner, but the breakfast was the stunner! the continental was very good if you got in fast. but as for the cooked, we tried all types of eggs over 5 days and none of them were particularly edible, we finished on boiled eggs. One, finally was perfect. The other three we could have played tennis with! Being of English descent we like tea in a pot, this was truly beyond the imagination of the staff and took 5 days to get it right (that was just the tea in the pot bit of it!) It pays to take your time describing the process and all will finally be well, don't forget to mention that the milk is traditionally cold. Have a great stay. ,

Reviews.Title: “No complaints at all, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: DD12345_00
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival we were told that our executive rooms were upgraded to suits - so that's a big plus! Apart from that: location is great; the street is central but somehow it's not noisy, I prefer to sleep with open windows so I could easily do that in my room.
