Our rooms were stylish (eventhough I'm not a big fan of the style they picked, but you can defintely trace the designer work); all facilities were new and worked fine; rooms are cleaned regularly and properly. My advice - try to get rooms on higher floors (5 or 6), they have nicer views. Very helful and polite staff (good spoken English). Fast room service. We really enjoyed our breakfast - which is not an often case with Paris hotels, even expensive ones. The selection of food was not overwhelming (but once again - it's Paris, not Emirates), but there was pretty much to every taste; selection of teas, fresh juice, several sorts of cheese, meat, pastry, yoghurts, salads, eggs etc. Didn't watch the TV so cannot really say much about the channel selection, but after all who cares about the TV when you're in Paris! )) Sooo either we got very lucky or this is a really good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Banke Hotel, a fantastic hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: NJDQ
Reviews.Content: I was initially recommended the Banke hotel by a colleague, then realised it's connected to the SLH chain (always a good sign!) so thought I would book. The reason for the visit was to meet friends in Paris, I arrived slightly earlier and the hotel confirmed our rooms were close together and with a price of 140Euros p/night including breakfast, "very reasonable for Paris" I thought. The first night unfortunately the aircon in my room was not working but they obligingly moved me to another room / bigger suite !! All questions, service etc dealt with promptly and politely. Location is perfect : almost opposite Galleries Lafayette, close to underground so easily accessible to all major sights and even although on a busy road, all rooms are very quiet !! Breakfast is a buffet style but a great selection. The bar is quite retro style, gold coloured bulls on the wall, huge red leather sofas in the lobby and a black plastic rhino - it's funny - it calms down what could be a stuffy, old fashioned entrance ... Whenever I have the chance to visit Paris again, this is where I will stay !!

Reviews.Title: “New Stylish Convenient and Very Comfortable in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: francc
Reviews.Content: The Bank is an Unusual Concept Hotel and part of the Small Luxury Hotels of the World "association" . It is New Stylish Funky and Very Comfortable. The Lobby Restaurant and Bar are Stylish and quite over the top in a nice way. The room I had was decent sized well laid out nicely furnished and very comfortable. The beds and pillows were of very good quality as were the sheets towels etc. The room is unbelievably quiet for something in the city. Location is great for someone who likes to shop being just 5 minutes walk to the Big Department Stores and 15 minutes away to stand alone Big Brand Stores. The staff is attentive and very helpful. Rates are great for what you get for the moment since the hotel is still relatively new and less known. Definitely will return to the Banke.

Reviews.Title: “No Major problems, Would use again!”
Reviews.Author: Eugegall
Reviews.Content: It was our second anniversary on 4th July 2010. I wanted to make it special for my partner as I do every year. Last year was Athens and this year was Paris,. Firstly it was the most difficult place to find a nice modern hotel with a reasonable price. I’m quite fussy but after a very long search I came across hotel banke. It looked perfect for what I was looking for. I managed to get a suite within my budget which was great. Overall the hotel was nice, Clean and comfortable. The staff we friendly and it was in a good location. If i had to be honest about the negatives then the mini bar was way overprice. 8 Euro's for a can of Coke! 7 Euro's for a 250ml of water. I thought this was a joke. For this reason we didn’t even entertain the idea of going to the hotel restaurant or bar. Oh also the cheapest bottle of wine was 45 Euro's. To beat this we went to the local shop and got 2 bottles of wine and some snacks for our stay. After leaving them in our room with the do not disturb on we came back to find them all missing like we had never been to the shop. I was very annoyed at (A) they went in the room with the sign on the door (B) that this happened in the first place. I have to say that they did handle it very well and apologised and replaced the missing goods. Lastly the hotel looks beautiful and it will certainly impress anyone walking through those doors BUT its way too dark, they could do so much better with the lighting. This is the only thing that really put me off. Oh and no one so far has mentioned the rumble of the metro every 4 minutes. Even throughout the night. Yes even from the 4th floor. Overall the hotel was good. Little over priced but i would stay there again. Thank you for the service and happy trading.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Higasa
Reviews.Content: Staff were very friendly and helpful, and the location was very handy. The room was small, but I assume that is Paris. Tastefully decorated and the view from the room was quite nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Needed a rest...”
Reviews.Author: Skofy
Reviews.Content: ...but finally was disappointed as I was freezing whole night. Simply, the heating mode on the airconditioning wasn't working :-(....At 6.15am some sort of a fire alarm woke me up and finally at 9.00am I escaped from the room as the construction works began on the road below my room window...nice hotel, but...better luck next time maybe :-)

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: Fairreviews
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took my sister and brother in law to Paris as a surprise "60th" birthday present, as they had never been before, and any old excuse to go to Paris! After much research, and many visits to Paris, usually staying at the Park Hyatt Vendome, we read the reviews on Banke, as the rate (together with the exchange rate) was ridiculous at the PHV (€650 per night per room!). This is a fantastic boutique hotel in the Opera district, walkable everywhere. Admittedly, they knew the purpose of our visit and being an SLH member, they upgraded the birthday boy to a suite, at no additionla charge to us. The rooms are on the small side, its the very nature of the converted building, so you should accpet that, however they are well decorated and have excellent facilities, comfy beds, aircon etc... The front of house staff are superb, and special thanks must go to Emanuel, who organised a private tour guilde and tickets to the Lido. The entrance is spectacular, however the bar is a big disappointment, no atmosphere, and not very inviting. We only had one drink there, and when we asked for a glass of wine, we were told they don't serve wine at the bar! Overall a great stay, great room rate, and excellent value for money. We had two lovely rooms overlooking Sacre Coeur on the 4th floor for less than the price of 1 room in the Park Hyatt! have breakfast at one of the cafes, not in the hotel. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a stay in Paris. The...”
Reviews.Author: hibiyaparker
Reviews.Content: Great choice for a stay in Paris. The location is the best feature--within an easy walk to the Galleries Lafayette, Opera and (perhaps most critically) Roissybus stop. The building is an old bank building and the rooms are essentially converted from offices in an ultra-stylish dark decor. Some rooms are a bit awkward to navigate and ventilation/air conditioning is not great. The breakfast buffet is as good as any I have seen in Europe. Overall a good deal for central Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A great little find....”
Reviews.Author: Sun Lounge Lizard
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay in Banke after reading the reviews here and checking out room rates with other hotels in Paris. Although we have been to Paris many times we wanted to find somewhere a little bit different this time. As has been said in other reviews it was originally a bank and so has retained a lot of it's architecture. Once through the front door you are in a rotunda with the reception ahead, the restaurant on your left and the bar on your right, it's is quite spectacular and all decked out red and gold and although it can seem a little dark it really fits in with the building. We were travelling with another couple and our rooms were at the top of the hotel, the 6th floor, our room was small but perfectly functional, my husband had to take his lap top and was able to catch up on a couple of hours work with no problem. The bed was comfortable and although the bathroom was quite small it suited us as we were barely in the hotel. Well how can you - you are in PARIS for goodness sake! All the staff we met were really friendly, especially Emmanuelle on reception who gave us some great recommendations for restaurants and booked a tour guide (our friends had never been to Paris), and tickets for the Lido. The location is fine, if you arrive on Eurostar and have little luggage you can walk it in about 15 minutes from the Gare du Nord. Unlike a previous reviewer we found plenty of restaurants open once the shops had closed.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: areopagus88
Reviews.Content: I'm not usually somebody who stays at a trendy boutique hotel, though more and more I find myself doing so because these days you can get great deals at such places. I found a special advance purchase deal at this hotel through the Small Luxury Hotels slh.com website for EUR198 a night, which is pretty good for a four-star hotel in Paris, with breakfast included and complimentary wifi Internet. I booked for two nights. The experience started badly from the start. I arrived on foot with two bags in two. There were two men standing against the wall in front of the hotel - neither wore anything that indicated they were Banke employees. (Whatever the management says to the contrary, I maintain that this is the case.) So as I made to enter the hotel and carry my bags up the stairs at the entrance, one of these men asked to help. I was very wary of the approach because there was no way for me to know if this person was actually a hotel employee. So I carried my bags up myself until I got into the hotel door. The check-in itself was okay but there was no care to confirm the rate and room type (executive double) that I had booked. The lobby itself was very interesting. The building used to be a bank. The decor may not be to everybody's taste, but it looked like a fun place and I generally found it appealing. Once in the room, I was somewhat disappointed. I found it odd that a room that is supposed to be for an executive had NO DESK or workspace. And the only place to sit was an uncomfortable bench built into the wall!!!!!! Otherwise, you had to sit on the bed!!!! Very weird. The room was large enough and so was the bathroom (separate from the toilet room). But again, the designer-itis (obsession with form over function) showed through. The lack of any proper workspace was one problem. The lack of any security peephole in the door so that you can check who is at the door was another. The owners seemed to not really think about the needs of the guest. Less than an hour after settling into my room, I tried to get on the Internet. I was told that the wifi was out of order and that a technician was supposedly on the way to fix it. This turned out NOT to be true. I was invited to use the Internet at the reception. I thought this meant the lobby. In fact, it literally meant the reception!!!!! They put me at one of the computer terminals of the front desk. NO CHAIR!!!!! The screen was too low. The keyboard was the weird French keyboard. This was simply no way to do work or even to check email. I asked if there was any other option such as a desk with a computer - No, I was told. This was simply unacceptable and I told the management so. Some manager named Stella offered excuses - the Internet problem was not the hotels. But the fact that the hotel could not offer an adequate failsafe option for the busted Internet was again a major fault, in my view. I decided to check out only after one night and demanded a refund for the second night. The hotel agreed but for some reason refunded me what had been charged for the second night minus EUR24. I emailed them to ask why and to demand the EUR24 back but NEVER GOT A RESPONSE. I stayed the one night, which was pleasant enough. The bar was quite good - I liked its arrangement. For a Friday night, however, it was dead! I went back the next night to check it out because I liked the feel of it, but it was similarly dead!!! In fact, the best part of the hotel was the bar - the two bartenders there... Michael and another young fellow...were great. On the Saturday night (after I had moved out), I chatted with them for a while and they were very accommodating and friendly. That bar and the bartenders deserve more patronage. After staying the night, I left for another hotel in the morning. I did have breakfast in the breakfast room in the basement. I don't get why they make you have breakfast in the dungeon where it's dark, rather than upstairs where you can get some natural light. The breakfast buffet spread was pretty mediocre - certainly not worth paying what they charge. So would I stay again at the Banke? Only if I could get another good package deal and the Internet service were working. On check in, I found the staff member there - some clean-cut French guy - to have been so frustratingly impertinent. He insisted several times that the staff member who met me at the door of the hotel had a hotel badge on. Even if that had been the case, which it wasn't, he should have let it go and just given me, the customer, the benefit of the doubt. He also refunded me less than what I actually paid for for the second night.

Reviews.Title: “I expected more than I found”
Reviews.Author: JJGM
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small and impersonal. For this category and price level hotels we think is reasonable better rooms. It was winter and we had to tell the concierge twice every day to increase the temperature in our room... when we arrived every night it wasn't comfortable to sleep. The building and lobby are beautiful but extremely dark. Location is perfect if you like Opera district.

Reviews.Title: “great building but lacks atmosphere, still finding its feet and too dark”
Reviews.Author: JohnLLondon
Reviews.Content: this is a very masculine property, perhaps not surprising as it used to be a bank. I am surprised, for a hotel located near to a business district that there is no desk in the bedrooms, it would be impossible to do any work here. Our room was certainly well proportioned with 3 huge windows but even so it seemed dark because all of the furnishings and textiles are very dark. Our bathroom was enormous but a bit soulless; the shower could have taken 4 people. There are endless light switches in the room but there never seemed to be enough light. It was not a room that you wanted to spend time in. The restaurant and bar nearly always seemed to be empty, despite it being a weekend. the whole place just feels a bit dead and too trendy for its own good; its not a particularly welcoming environment although the staff do their job well. Breakfast is taken downstairs where there is virtually no natural light and the ceilings are very low giving a feeling of claustrophobia. Also it is far too hot, none of these are pleasurable sensations particularly at breakfast. The meal itself is fine although service is uneven. Why not leave a coffee pot on the table rather than having to attract the attention of the waiter who is more interested in looking at his own reflection. There is no indication that you could have a cooked breakfast but if you ask you can have eggs. A hotel of this standard should inform you of this fact. I think they would be far better off serving breakfast on the ground floor; there is plenty of room and it would give the impression of some life. They need more Parisians to use the bar and restaurant but then again these outlets have only recently opened so maybe in a year there will be more of a buzz. I have stayed at a lot of SLH hotels; this one is still finding its feet. It does not feel very French; it has an int'l design template that could frankly be anywhere. If you come to Paris you want to feel that you are in Paris, particularly at this price bracket. In a year it might have more life. Spotlessly clean though and some people might love it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Michel99
Reviews.Content: My stay for euro 165 per night including breakfast for a double room made my stay into a pleasant one. It's a very nice and trendy hotel but.. Not worth more than I paid. Regular price 250 excl breakfast and up. Breakfast is very nice but not worth the 28 euro's pp. Will come back when on promotion.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grainnew
Reviews.Content: Just spent three nights in Hotel Banke. The location is very good for CGD as the Roissy bus stops very close to the hotel just outside the Opera House. The location is also good for shopping but offers little of interest in the way of restaurants/cafes once the shops close. However everything is within walking distance and is good if you want to wander the streets and absorb the city. Booked the "special rate" which included breakfast, which in a city that doesn't seem to notice the global recession is a plus. However the breakfast option was way over priced at €28 (if one was paying seperately) as noted on their website. Everything was cold, with no offer of even a basic omellete. I like a decent big mug of coffee in the morning and so I had to ask each morning for a refill of my small cup. It would have been more welcoming for the staff to offer refills - coffee is not that precious! The room was small but clean and well equipped with storage. The bathroom was split over two rooms -the toilet room and the bath/shower and wash basin room - which worked well from the point of two people using the facilites at the same time. The extract fans in both rooms were not working. The bed could have been a little harder for my liking - but was a reasonable size, given the overall room dimensions and probably would suit most people. The room was very hot at night so much so that I had to open the windows. Again I think there was a problem with the air handling in the room. On our first night we were greated by a bottle of water and some homemade chocolates on a dish and suger canes on both pillows. This was a nice touch, however short lived.....second and third night saw no sign of any water or chocolates and I think they recycled our canes!!!!! The reception staff were all very nice and helpfull if asked a question. However it would have been nice to have some general informaion about Paris, especially the local area, including a map t be left in the hotel room. Overall it was a reasonable hotel even though internationally Paris hotel rates are way overpriced for what one gets.

Reviews.Title: “28 Euros for a cup of tea ?!”
Reviews.Author: LH_NewForest
Reviews.Content: For our weekend in Paris, my friend and I decided to splash out on a Superior room at the Banke Hotel. On arrival we were delighted to hear that we'd been upgraded to a suite. However, the "suite" wasn't very impressive - it was simply a standard sized hotel room with a nice bathroom (bath as well as shower) and bath robes and slippers were provided. Not what we were expecting as a suite.... but a reasonable room nontheless. However, our main complaint about the Banke Hotel was that tea and coffee making facilities were not provided in our room (or in any of the rooms at the hotel). When we asked about having tea delivered to our room by room service in the morning we were informed that between 07:00 and 11:00, whilst breakfast was being served, tea could be provided but would be charged at the price of a continental breakfast, 28 Euros per person !! Is it really reasonable for a hotel charging as much as the Banke Hotel for a room only to ask customers to pay this much for a simple cup of tea or coffee in the morning ?? We thought not.

Reviews.Title: “Trying Hard”
Reviews.Author: shalders
Reviews.Content: The Banke Hotel received a good write up in Australias Qantas magazine so this was the reason why we chose to stay at the Hotel. The negatives outweigh the positives so here they are; There was no iron in the room so we used the Hotel fast service, 3 shirts were given at midday and requested that they be returned for dinner & a show by 7pm that day. The Hotel staff said that this would be fine. At 7pm no shirts had been returned. Hotel staff said they would follow-up but we received no reply. The next day we asked for the shirts to be available by that evening - they weren't. So again we went out to dinner in rumpled clothes. It was only when my husband said we were leaving early the next morning and got cross that the hotel staff cared. The shirts arrived 10pm that night. We asked why there wasn't an iron anywhere in the Hotel, and were told they were considered dangerous. Pathetic. We were in room 317 - very difficult to get around the end of the bed and almost no area around the side when the 2 bags were placed on the floor. The air conditioning in this room is useless, again we discussed this with the hotel staff. They looked into this and solved it by turning it up higher. It just made the room even hotter. We solved it by opening our room door to let some cool air in. Unacceptable in a 4 star hotel. The Hotel has a nice decor but the basics need to be attended to.

Reviews.Title: “The jury is still out”
Reviews.Author: narciso2701
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, great location, very clean, cool design,.... but.... ....the bathroom was really ridiculous! The person who designed that must have been drunk or high! It was one of the most ugly, badly designed bathrooms I have ever seen in my life. When you open the door, you actually cut the bathroom in 2 and you have to squeeze yourself between the sink and the door to get from 1 side to the other. If there is somebody in front of the mirror, watch out when opening the door. Why they didn´t go for a sliding door is beyond me. And then we experienced what every hotel guest dreds: flooding of the bathroom when taking a shower. That is a problem that can easily be fixed. Why they don´t fix it is, again, beyond me. We ordered room service 3 times: First time was just ice. They charged 6€ for a glass filled with ice. Bit steep I would say. Second time was between 3-4 am --> very limited offer. The third time was on Sunday afternoon. There we could choose from the whole menu. Service was quick and the food was good. Overal I would say a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ParisloverKentucky
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Banke was in tip top condition. The staff was attentive. Suite was large, beds very clean and comfortable. Bathroom, shower and hot water were great. Air conditioning worked wonderfully. Shopping close. Many Metro stations within steps of hotel. Cannot say one negative thing about our 8 day stay there.

Reviews.Title: “MAGNIFIQUE!!”
Reviews.Author: 333bennyboy333
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing, tremendous service from the start, right through till the end of our 3 night stay, the included breakfast is a phenomenal choice of cold meats, fruit, cereal and pastries. The rooms are beautiful and comfortable, i wish that i had uploaded my photos to show you but suffice it to say that the photos on the website portray it very accurately. Mum and I were extremely pleased, it was also very good value for money, thank you banke hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Acceptable but not Overwhelm !”
Reviews.Author: luxadvisor
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is new and only few months old (opened in April 2009). It is a part of Derby Hotel Collections based in Spain - developed with modern concept in mind. They have a quiet numbers of good properties - such as Claris in Barcelona or Hotel Urban in Madrid. Trying to branch out of Spain, Banke is their second properties after London (The Caesar). Flipping through my Hotel bookmark list for Paris, this belovely city only has around 25-35 hotels that I can consider as a 4 to 5 stars properties (from Geoerge V to small boutique Hotel Kappler), with rate starting around €200/night in high season. Hoel Banke got my attention not only because of its best location (especially for shopping) but also becaused its original building architekture and the most the promotion price offered which is very low. I decided to try one night stay at this property - only to get a glimps - see if this new property really worth 4 stars rating. Arrival was Ok, The bellperson were available upon arrival and did offered his assistance immediately. Check in went smooth - standard service, lack of personal touch (smile and warmness feeling of welcome). The room was small but well appointed. The bathroom is clean and has separate WC. My room has a few direct to Rue La Fayette, it gave more light to the room. I love the original High Celling struckture which give more roomy feeling. The hotel restaurant and lobby bar look wonderful but I did not try them . My overall rating for this hotel will be OK - Standard acceptable service. It will be in the 3,5 stars category of accommodation. This will be a good place for the business travellers or the tourists who don't need extra services and are please with good value offers, clean room and good location. The free Internet is a good added value to the hotel rate. Will I stay at this property again ? Depends.. Will they still offer the good Promotion Rate? For the good value and good location, I certainly can recommend this property. ONLY do not expect much.., it is just a standard service hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but responsiveness to theft a major concern”
Reviews.Author: bustraveller73
Reviews.Content: I'll give the good points first. For the area, the hotel is very nice and a good value. The rooms are nice, clean and modern. Aircon issues may have been a new opening issue, because they are fixed now. I have stayed in the Banke several times as well as many other hotels within walking distance as I have an office near the Bourse in Paris. The bell/concierge staff and the front desk staff are generally very good and friendly and one of the bright spots of the hotel. Be wary of the great deals and free breakfast referred to in many post- they were intro offers to get good reviews of the hotel and have now been discontinued. That being said, the hotel would still be a good value if not for the reasons below. I would not recommend the hotel, nor could I find myself staying there again due to a lack of responsiveness of the hotel management after I informed them that we had money stolen from our room. It was in my wife's wallet, in her purse, in her suitcase- so it took quite some attempt by the thief to get to it- a major concern that your personal items are not safe in the room!! Of even bigger concern was that the hotel management is apparantely not too concerned with theft from the rooms in their hotel. This occured on Saturday during the afternoon/evening and as I type on Monday afternoon, I still have yet to receive a response other than "we'll look into it". Nothing has been done yet, because apparently the general manager is the only on empowered to investigate, and they would not be able to get to it until the work week (which I still have not heard anything at this point). I'd expect theft to be a high priority- it is not. Safety and protection of my personal goods are the #1 concern to me in a hotel, thus all other good points(which there are many) are negated. Small time theft, I'm not concerned about the money, but the principal remains that the management is not concerned with this type of event.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: bi17
Reviews.Content: This is the first contemporary hotel in Paris. No woodchip on the wall or ceiling, no kitschy fake-french-style furniture. What you get instead is a comfy bed with stainless linen (not easy to find in Paris), a clean and ultra-modern room in a perfect location with excellent connection to metro and bus and airport-shuttle, young staff and an extraordinary good value for the money. Oh- the restaurant is a quiet oasis with excellent food. Forget the dirty tourist traps in St. Germain!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant! Absolutely loved it!”
Reviews.Author: treatmenice
Reviews.Content: Thank goodness I didn't read the reviews before staying here...which I usually always do! I loved it! Absolutely loved it! From the minute you walk in the door, we were made to feel special! Reading previous articles... about no air con..ours had it! Poor service from the reception...I found them to be particularly helpful, and helped me try and track down a missing credit card I left behind in a restaurant! Breakfast was wonderful too... as was the service! The thing that hits you as you first enter the hotel is the smell... wonderful! The grandeur of the hotel is breathtaking, and the room was perfect! (108) smallish... but oh so perfect and bigger than most hotels in London by comparisson! It's location is great...right next to the metro, the Opera House, and Gallerie La Fayette for shopping! Sorry...I feel like I should be earning comission, as I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough! We got a great deal too... with the hotel direct! Please stay here... it really is lovely! Trendy, cool and modern!

Reviews.Title: “AVOID IT”
Reviews.Author: explanation
Reviews.Content: the staff at the Banke think that they are doing you a favor. the rooms are small and the location isnt that great unless you only plan to visit Galeries Lafayette. The concierge is limited to a computer with internet and google and when you ask them for a sugestion for lets say a restaurant the concierge googles it¡¡ Not really what you look for

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Banke
HotelInfo.Address: 20 Rue Lafayette, 75009 Paris, France
